samples.context: In a school, every student is either studying in the library or playing outside. Notably, on Friday, Lily was not seen studying in the library.
samples.question: Can we infer that Lily was playing outside on Friday?

samples.context: At a restaurant, every customer is either dining in or ordering takeout. It is known that on Saturday, Tom did not dine in at the restaurant.
samples.question: Does this suggest that Tom ordered takeout on Saturday?

samples.context: In a bookstore, every book is either fiction or non-fiction. Interestingly, on Sunday, Jane was not reading a fiction book.
samples.question: Can we infer that Jane was reading a non-fiction book on Sunday?

samples.question: Does this imply that Alex was having a picnic on Monday?

samples.question: Can we assume that Mark was in the surgical ward on Tuesday?

samples.question: Does this imply that Alex was studying in the library on Friday?

samples.question: Does this mean the horses were grazing in the pasture on that day?

samples.question: Does this imply that the horse was grazing in the field on the sunny day?

samples.context: In a bookstore, every book is either on the shelf or on the display table. Interestingly, on a rainy day, the mystery novel was not on the display table.
samples.question: Can we deduce that the mystery novel was on the shelf on the rainy day?
